content: Lifestyle General Asked by Good Day Every DayAsked on 27 Jun 2019I was charged $0.60 for making a call to join a group in England after downloading Telegram app. This is despite the fact that I used my data to make the call. Is this the norm? I am new to Telegram, so I'm unsure why I have to pay for a call?3 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 27 Jun 2019Not in my experience too!0 comments1

Huang Yixuan, Product Designer at SeedlyLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 28 Jun 2019What charged you the $0.60? App store or your phone company? I use Telegram to make calls all the time and was never charged before!2 comments1

Good Day Every Day27 Jun 2019MyRepublic charges me $0.60.Huang Yixuan28 Jun 2019I think it's your telco man. I think you should call MyRepublic to check. Are you tied under any contract?
Seems like there's a lot of issues with this telco 
https://seedly.sg/reviews/telco-mobile-plans/myrepublic-mobile

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterUpdated on 28 Jun 2019Not that I know of. You may want to call the telco to check?0 comments0
